Thank you for installing the Cacophonometer app.

The app will automatically make audio recordings every hour (and additional recordings around dawn and dusk) and upload them to the Cacophony Project data server. This will allow monitoring of birdsong near your phone. 

To use this app first register on the data server (https://browse.cacophony.org.nz/) AND create a group name (also on the server). 

Once you have created the group name on the data server, press the 'Basic Setup' button (in this app) and follow the instructions to configure the app. 

Once recordings have been sent to the server you will be able to log back in and listen to them - as will anyone who has your password!

We intend to perform automatic machine analysis of all recordings rather than have a human listen to each recording. We also expect to implement a system to automatically remove any speech present in the recordings.

If you believe you have inadvertently recorded a private conversation, please use the delete function on the server to remove it. 

Thank you again for supporting The Cacophony Project
 https://cacophony.org.nz/
Once you have created a group on the server, you can enter it in the 'Group Name' field, and also enter a unique name for your phone (at least 4 characters). Press the button to register. You will see messages informing you of progress - the last message will say that registration has been successful. 

You can un-register this device if you want to change the name. 

Once your phone has been successfully registered, press the 'NEXT-ROOTED' button.
Normally the app will not record when the battery is getting low. But, you can ignore a low battery when out walking or if you have just left the phone somewhere without power and you want it to keep recording until the battery goes flat. 

Note: It is NOT advisable to use this option if you are using a solar panel as once the battery has gone completely flat, the phone is very unlikely to turn back on even if the solar panel re-charges the battery. Keep recording with a low battery?
You may want to prevent the app from making recordings. This is useful if you have installed the app on a phone that you are now keeping close to you. If you choose this option, the \‘Disable Recording\’ button on the home screen will change colour to remind you that recording has been disabled. Turn off the Cacophonometer - This will disable all recordings (even after a restart). The App\’s default settings have been chosen to be suitable for most situations and so the following should only be changed if you have a good reason.

Record More Often: The App will make recordings every hour during the day and night, and every ten minutes for an hour each side of dawn and dusk. This frequency is seen as a good compromise between getting a reasonable sample of bird song, not overloading the Cacophony server and saving power. If you need to, you can choose to \’Record more often\’ which will increase the frequency to record every 15 minutes through out the day and night. There is also the possibility that at some point in the future, the server may limit the number of recordings received from a device.

Upload after every recording: If you are not concerned with how much power your phone is using and you can’t wait to hear your birds, then this option will upload each recording as soon as it has finished – rather than every six hours. 

Periodically update GPS will attempt to get a new GPS location every 15 minutes. This option is automatically selected when you choose walking mode, but if you know that you will not be able to get a GPS location, turning this off may save some power.
Setting the GPS location is very useful for keeping track of the phone. Press the button below to set the location (you may be asked to turn on location/gps). It could take a minute to get a location. If you are moving about, you can check the box below so that the location updates every five minutes (will use more power). Press the button and then wait for the phone to get a new GPS location. You may need to go outside.
The App can work in a number of internet connection configurations - BUT it is most likely that your will use it in 'Normal' mode. 

If your phone has been rooted, \’Normal\’ mode will enable the phones flight (airplane) mode to save power. If the phone has NOT been rooted, still use Normal mode and the app will work just fine. 

If you are going to be using the phone to make recordings in a location that you know has no internet connection, then use \’Offline\’ mode and the app will not waste power by attempting to acquire an internet connection. Also manually enable airplane mode as the phone will not be able to do this automatically if it hasn\’t been rooted. 

'Online' mode will not enable airplane mode. It requires the phone to be plugged into the mains power supply as it will use too much power to work with a solar panel. Online mode is useful if you want to remotely access your phone, perhaps because you have remote control software installed. If the phone isn\’t in Online mode, you would be very unlikely to be able to connect to the phone. Choose the internet connection mode. If you are not sure, read the help or just choose 'Normal'
Has your phone been rooted?
If you got this phone from The Cacophony Project, please leave the setting as you found it (probably – YES). We normally root the phone to enable the app to save power – pretty essential for using with a solar panel. Note: Choosing YES, does NOT root the phone (it's a bit more involved).
Play a short warning sound before a recording is made (useful for when out walking with the phone or testing at home). 

Note: using an external microphone will probably disable this function. Play a warning sound before a recording starts. App Testers: Use the test server which will allow you to increase the recording frequency and use short recordings. Note: Data and recordings on the server are likely to be wiped at some point. Use the test server? Using the Record Now button will allow you to get immediate feedback on whether your phone has been setup correctly. 

The app will record for the normal length of one minute, so you will need to wait that long (A series of messages are displayed to give you feedback on the progress of recording and uploading to the server. 

The Record Now button is disabled (greyed out)if a recording is already in progress, or if the app has been disabled. You can enable the app from the Home screen. Once the file(s) have been uploaded, you can confirm this by checking on the server page. Upload or delete all the recordings on the phone Normally you will not need to \’Manage Recordings\’ as the app will automatically upload your recordings to the server.

However, if you have been using the phone without an internet connection (perhaps you have been for a walk or have just re-established an internet connection after leaving your phone to make recordings in a location without out internet access) you can now use this screen to upload all the recordings on the phone to the server. 

Before you press the upload button, the number of recordings currently on the phone is displayed and should change to zero if all the recordings are successfully uploaded.

If you prefer, you can delete all the recordings on the phone – perhaps you didn’t realize you had been making recordings! Careful with this option – you can’t get them back.
The Vitals screen displays some useful information about the status of the app. 

Version ID is the version of this App. 

Required Permission should have a tick to show that the app is able to do recording and access the internet. 

Registered should have a tick to indicate that the app has successfully registerd.

Logged on to Server should have a tick to show that connection to the server can be established. 

Device name should show the name that you gave your phone. 

Latitude and Longitude display the GPS location of the phone for the last time the GPS was successfully updated. 

Last Recording gives the date and time of the last recording, and Next Recording indicates the time that the next recording is set to occur. If the phone app is currently disabled it say Disabled. 

Messages displays any extra information. 

The REFRESH button will attempt to reconnect with the server to check that a connection can still be established.
Walking mode is designed for using when you are out for a walk! If you are just going to leave the phone in a fixed location, walking mode should be set to OFF. 

In walking mode, the phone will automatically do the following: make a recording every 15 minutes, periodically update the GPS location, it will not attempt to upload the recordings to the server, will keep recording when the battery is getting low and attempt to make a warning sound (an external microphone and/or other phone settings may mute this feature). 

See the Upload Files screen for when you have finished your walk.
